title: What Would McGyver Do
description:
YouÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re driving on a deserted road when your car dies. Your cell phone isnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t getting service. All you have on hand are a gum wrapper and a wire hanger.
Or maybe youÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re living in a building without central air conditioning in July. You canÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t afford an AC; all you have access to are a fan and a bucket of water.

In such times of desperation, many have called upon the symbol of all that is inventive, the hero who awed thousands with his cool, quick wit: What would MacGyver do? they ask..

For anyone whoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s ever wished they could channel the 1980s action-adventure icon comes this clever collection of forty-five true stories, commemorating the use of improvised genius to solve everyday problems. Inspired by televisionÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Angus MacGyver (played by Richard Dean Anderson), a secret agent who relied on his brains and scientific prowessÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½not to mention duct tape and a Swiss Army knifeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½to save the day, the "MacGyverisms" recounted range from the concrete (using Chex Mix to provide traction in an icy parking lot) to the intangible (saving a relationship with the perfect turn of phrase). Edgy, entertaining, and smirk-to-yourself funny, these masterfully told stories reveal that, with a little luck and a lot of ingenuity, you can "MacGyver" yourself out of virtually any predicament.
